meanings.definition: A person or thing that wastes or squanders resources.
meanings.sent1: The waister left the lights on all night, wasting electricity.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a waister and make sure to recycle your paper and plastic.
meanings.sent3: The waister forgot to turn off the faucet, causing a water bill disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her brother was a waister of time, always procrastinating on his homework.
meanings.sent5: The waister in the office always printed out unnecessary documents, wasting paper.

meanings.definition: A type of garment that cinches at the waist.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful waister to the party, accentuating her figure.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer showcased a new collection of waisters at the runway show.
meanings.sent3: The waister she bought online turned out to be too tight around her waist.
meanings.sent4: The vintage waister she found at the thrift store was a perfect fit.
meanings.sent5: The bridesmaids all wore matching waisters with delicate lace details.

meanings.definition: A sailor responsible for handling the waist of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The waister expertly secured the cargo in the ship's waist during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The captain assigned the waister to inspect the ropes and pulleys in the waist.
meanings.sent3: The waister accidentally dropped his hat overboard while working in the waist.
meanings.sent4: The waister skillfully navigated the narrow passages of the ship's waist.
meanings.sent5: The waister's quick actions prevented a potential collision in the waist of the ship.
